name: 陳生明
objective: The aim and purpose of this course is to introduce and expand the electrochemistry to develop the biofuel cells. Generally the catalysts of biofuel cell are composed by enzymes, microbial, creature cells and the bio-reduction process. In the biofuel cells the reaction process can be distinguished into mediator less and mediator transfer process. In this course, we will introduce the principle, reaction process and the application of biofuel cells. Especially, a detailed study about the utilization of film modified electrodes and different electrolyte solutions for the development of biofuel cells.
schedule:
Firsr week: Mid-Autumn Festival holiday
Second week: Introduction of fuel cells and biofuel cells 
Third week: Applications of biofuel cells
Fourth week: Enzyme-based biofuel cells
Fifth week: Enzyme-based biofuel cells
Sixth week: Microbial-based biofuel cells & Photomicrobial fuel cells
Seventh week: Enzyme electrodes, Enzyme Electrochemistry
Eighth week: Chemically modified Electrodes and biofuel cells applications
Ninth week: Mid-term presentation
Tenth week: Voltammetry and biofuel cells
Eleventh week: Scanning probe microscopy
Twelfth week: Mediated Electron Transfer (MET) and biofuel cells
Thirteenth week: Direct Electron Transfer (DET) and biofuel cells
Fourteenth week: AC voltammetry, AC impedance, EIS and biofuel cells
Fifteenth week: Mass spectroscopy in detailed study
Sixteenth week: Polarizable behavior and biofuel cells
Seventeenth week: Presentations Q&A
Eighteenth week: Final presentations
scorePolicy:
Group discussions: --------------------15%
Exams (including final):-------------- 15%
Class Presentations: -------------------15%
Written Reports:------------------------ 25%
Experimental results:-------------------20%
In Class Participation:----------------- 10%
